title: Does Trump’s Residency Change Mean He Committed Voter Fraud in 2018 or 2020?
subtitle: In most states, the law provides for a broad interpretation of "residency" when it comes to elections.
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: Because U.S. President Donald Trump changed his legal residence to Mar-a-Lago in 2018, he committed voter fraud in either the 2018 midterm election, the 2020 presidential election, or both.
